fields.description:
h3. Issue description
A lot of Jira users complains about the new Jira issue view, so they have the option to turn off at Jira Labs, with that, the Jira issue view returns to the old UI, but this has a bug with the scroll bar at the issue view going past the bottom  of the screen and not at the end of the last item.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Turn off the new Jira issue view (turn off Jira Labs)
# Access a Scrum board > Active Sprints
# Select an issue
# Add a comment
# Scroll the bar and it will pass through the last item showing a lot of blank content at the page

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected results
The scroll bar should stop at the last item available at the page

h3. Actual results
The scroll bar goes through the last item available at the page and shows a blank content at the page.
fields.summary: At Active sprint, using old jira issue view, the scroll bar goes past the bottom of the screen

fields.description:
In the following screenshot I would like my team members to be able to hide the columns that are not applicable to them (but they should be able to turn them on if and when they do become applicable):

!image-2018-09-05-11-25-08-127.png!

*Motivation for request* - It is useful to have extra columns so that our QA process can have it's own columns, and UX can have it's own columns, and developers can have their own columns; but the issue is that when there are too many columns the tickets become too small and difficult to read and work with.

As an example with the following columns:
 * TODO
 * IN PROGRESS
 * READY FOR REVIEW
 * IN REVIEW
 * READY FOR QA
 * IN QA
 * DONE

A developer would see these columns:
 * TODO
 * IN PROGRESS
 * READY FOR REVIEW
 * IN REVIEW
 * READY FOR QA
 * DONE

Whilst a QA would see these columns:
 * READY FOR QA
 * IN QA
 * DONE
fields.summary: Add per-user option to toggle visibility of columns in SCRUM board

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When you specify certain issue types in the board's filter, the inline issue creation in the board's backlog does not work.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create Agility project A1
 # Create Legacy Kanban project K1
 # Create new board in K1, include `issueType in (story, epic)` in the Board's filter
 # Use postman or curl: `GET /rest/inline-create/1.0/context/bootstrap?query=project%20%3D%20K1%20and%20issueType%20in%20(epic%2C%20story)%20ORDER%20BY%20Rank%20ASC`

h3. Expected Results

Inline issue creation works as expected on the backlog
h3. Actual Results

The inline does not work. The issue creation pop-up is displayed
h3. Notes
h3. Workaround
 - Add 'task' issue type to filter or, 
 - Remove filter changes
fields.summary: Depending on the board's filter, the inline issue creation in the board's backlog does not work

fields.description: There are times when we need to know when a Jira ticket is created through an email. We'd like to add a label or component when it's coming from an email.
fields.summary: Add labels and Components field to Email Handler

fields.description:
The Sidebar Menu in the new Jira Layout does not appear to lock when it is expanded. This is specifically occurring on the Filters pages.

*Browser/OS:* Chrome v68 - Mac High Sierra
fields.summary: Sidebar Menu does not lock when expanded.

fields.description:
h3. Summary:

The find option (Command + F on MAC) doesn't work properly on cards JIRA Software Boards on Chrome.
h3. Steps to reproduce:
 * Navigate to a JIRA Software Board (Kanban or Scrum)
 * Add a sprint and some issues to this sprint
 * Navigate to the *Active Sprints*
 * Try to use the find option (Command F) to search for any issues
 * *However, if you search for the complete issue key (e.g TP-23)*
 * Please, check the video attached to check more details about the issue

h3. Expected Results

The issue should appear on the find bar and would be highlighted.
h3. Actual Results

The issue does not appear in the bar and it is not highlighted.
h3. Workaround
 * If you search only for the project prefix, you will find many issues.
 * If you search only for the issue ID (*e.g. 23*), you will find the issue you want.

h3. Notes

The issue was reported as a Bug at JSWCLOUD-16145 and it's closed as Won't do. Raising it as a feature request on behalf of customer.
{quote}
This issue will be fixed shortly with the release of a new board filter (including text search in Work mode).

A temporary workaround is to search for issue number instead of the full issue key.
{quote}
fields.summary: Find option on board cards doesn't work for Issue Key

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Burndown chart report shows story points estimation as "0" if an "In progress" status is moved to the right-most column
h3. Environment
Jira Software cloud


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In a Scrum board with estimation set to story points, create some stories
# Set estimation to the stories
# Create a sprint and add the stories to it
# Start the sprint
# Map one of the "In progress" statuses to the right-most column
# Access the Burndown chart

h3. Expected Results

The Burndown chart shows the estimation values as it was defined on the issues

h3. Actual Results

Burndown chart shows the estimation of the issues in the "In progress" status mapped to the right-most column as "0"

 [^Screen Recording 2018-08-31 at 09.53 PM.mov] 


h3.Notes


h3.Workaround

* Move the "In progress" status to a different column
fields.summary: The Burndown chart report shows story points estimation as "0" if an "In progress" status is moved to the right-most column

fields.description:
Right now, you can filter by using a quick filter or by selecting the assignee.

It would be very useful if users could create filters such as the assignee filter, but for other fields such as project, components, issue type, etc.

For example, the *Project* filter would let the user choose one of the available projects on the board.

The use should have the option to customize new filters based on custom/system fields.
fields.summary: New customisable board filters such as the Assignee filter.

fields.description:
It would be good to have the ability to customize the default colour scheme in Jira Software.

Since the default scheme controls the default colours applied when new boards are created as well as when a priority is assigned to an issue, it would be very useful to be able to change the overall colour scheme.

For example, setting a colour system similar to the traffic light would be very user-friendly and intuitive:

Red - Highest Priority
 Yellow - High Priority
 Green - Medium priority
 and two different grey tones for the last two priorities
fields.summary: Change the overall (default) colour scheme

fields.description:
(I can't select the BAM project to create a ticket in even though I can see other tickets; I guess those permissions aren't set up?  Please move/re-triage as appropriate)

We have our Bamboo instance pointed to our git repositories on our GitHub Enterprise instance, and Bamboo is able to pull from those repositories fine, but there does not appear to be a way for the web links to actually point to the correct URL to see the commits.  I tried setting {{atlassian.bamboo.github.api.base.url}} to various values, and nothing seemed to work.  Please let me know if there's some other workaround I should try before this is more fully supported.  Thank you.
fields.summary: Web links from Bamboo to Github Enterprise

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The colors in the CFD do not overlap correctly. If one of the graphs reaches 0 at some point along the X-axis, but rises above 0 further right along the X-axis, that graph will be placed 'behind' other colors.

h3. Environment
Jira Software Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Create a Kanban or Scrum board and transition issues so that in the CFD, at some point along the X-axis, one of the graphs reaches 0 but rises above 0 afterward.

h3. Expected Results
The graphs would be rendered correctly, with the layer that has lower values on the Y-axis placed 'in front'

h3. Actual Results
Once one of the graphs has reached 0, the part further to the right that rises above 0 is hidden 'behind' the other layers. In the 2 screenshots below, please see the difference when 'in progress' (purple) is added to the diagram. The green area on the right, corresponding to 'Under Review' is hidden behind the blue area corresponding to 'To Do':
 !3 columns.png|thumbnail! 
 !added 'in progress'.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Hide some of the columns
fields.summary: cumulative flow diagram incorrectly rendered

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* You have a board filter that shows issues from all projects on your instance
* A new "Agility" project is created
* The statuses  "To Do", "In Progress" and "Done" associated to the newly created Agility project will need to manually mapped to the existing board
* Statuses need to be manually mapped

h3. Environment
* Jira Software

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new board with a filter that displays issues from all projects on the instance.  Something the below JQL should work:
{noformat}
status IS NOT EMPTY
{noformat}
# Check the column mappings on the new board ([Board Settings > Columns|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/configuring-columns-764477997.html])
# Create a new Agility project
# Check column mappings on the newly created board

h3. Expected Results
* Statuses are mapped as per the list of statuses in _https://<host_name>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ViewStatuses.jspa_ i.e. no duplicate statuses listed
* No manual mapping of statuses required as "To Do", "In Progress" and "Done" statues are already mapped
* "Duplicate" entries should be removed - _see Notes_

h3. Actual Results
|| Before new Agility project created || After new Agility project created ||
|   !image_2.png|thumbnail!   | !image_1.png|thumbnail!     |

h3. Notes
* This behaviour is technically correct, as new(hidden) statuses are created for Agility projects
* This is listed as a Bug and not a Feature Request because having to map "duplicate" statuses isn't intended behaviour

h3.Workaround
* Manually map the statuses
* Use the ticket counts(shown in the status cards) as a guide if not all statuses should be mapped
fields.summary: Agility project statuses need to be manually mapped on existing boards

fields.description:
In the old Jira issue view, there used to be a button that allowed users to add new issues to the epic directly from the epic itself rather than using the general purpose issue creation method which is a little ambiguous.

Please add the create issue in epic button back as it adds clarity to the intention of the user and is far more intuitive.
fields.summary: Add the create issue in epic button to Jira new issue view

fields.description:
Currently, we can only export versions when exporting all issues, but also it's not possible to filter by fix version release date [JRACLOUD-22640|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-22640].
It would be great if we have an option to export only Releases directly in the Releases' page.
fields.summary: Ability to export Releases/Versions
[FR Translation] missing quotes and injection errors

fields.description:
Hello,

We have the PegaPRPC 7.4 product and have installed the JiraIntegration plugin.

In the Pega properties window "PM_JIRA_AuthProfile", we have to use a single email account linked to our jira domain and we do not find an account like jira-slack-integration for Slack ...

Can you explain with which account jira should we use for our domain jira?

thank you very much

Sincere friendships

Jeremy
fields.summary: Jira integration for PEGA : With which account jira does we connect our jira domain

fields.description: The REST endpoint */rest/greenhopper/1.0/rapidview* is taking too long to respond in some large instances, and it causes the gadgets failed to load as it times out
fields.summary: /rest/greenhopper/1.0/rapidview is taking too long to respond

fields.description:
Is this a bug/ glitch or did I miss something in settings? Why is everything missing but the issues? Where is the title, the save as button, the details button and the search bar?

Jira -> search button (magnifying glass) -> view all issues. Takes you to this page (Issue navigator).

 

+*What it looks like:*+

!https://tnckb94959.i.lithium.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/8264i0B8379E770E52CF6/image-dimensions/2000?v=1.0&px=-1!

 

+*What it should look like:*+

*!https://tnckb94959.i.lithium.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/8263iB9B3DADBE7DCCFDB/image-dimensions/2000?v=1.0&px=-1!*

 

**I use filters quiet extensively and now can't use the advanced search option at all. This was working fine last night (8/27/18), I open it up today (8/28/18) and it looks glitched out. Please help!
fields.summary: Issue navigator - Advanced search bar missing

fields.description:
Create a dashboard using two different pie charts. 
Make them show tickets based on different filters, yielding different ticket lists.
Eg. I have a pie chart showing only "Closed" tickets, and a pie chart showing only "In Progress" tickets. 
Problem is, they are both showing a full blue circle, making it more difficult to distinguish.
It would be valuable to easily see, rather than read, the statuses of each.
fields.summary: Different colors for different statuses

fields.description: Same as with mentioning people, for example using `#` key would be nice to "mention" other issues.
fields.summary: shortcut for linking to other issues in descriptions/comments.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Having many JQL swimlanes in a board can break the Cumulative Flow Diagram report.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a board
 # Create many JQL based swimlanes (tested with 200+ swimlanes)
 # Check the Cumulative Flow Diagram report. 

h3. Expected Results
 * Show the report

 
h3. Actual Results
 * The report returns nothing 
 * A 400 (bad request) error is shown in the console  !image-2018-08-27-16-54-25-549.png|width=521,height=22!

h3. Notes

The actual limit can vary, we saw cases with around 150 swimlanes breaking.
h3. Workaround

Delete swimlanes until the gadget works. Changing the *"swimlanes based on"* to something else than JQL *does not fix the problem.* It is necessary to delete them.
fields.summary: Excessive swimlanes in a board can break the Cumulative Flow Diagram Report

fields.description:
h3. Summary Product names are written with unnecessary {{

}} tag. It breaks the page layout. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Navigate to the page like the following example. #* https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/configuring-collaboration-tools-764478060.html # Check product names (e.g. "Jira Software") in the page. h3. Expected Results Product names (e.g. "Jira Software") are written without unnecessary {{

}} tag. h3. Actual Results Product names (e.g. "Jira Software") are shown with unnecessary {{

}} tag and it breaks the page layout.
fields.summary: Certain product names are written with unnecessary p tag on CAC

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, only the Summary, the Issue Key, and an attachment are displayed on cards in Independent Projects, as shown in the Agility project board shown in the screenshot below:
* !OW_board_-_Agile_board_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow users to select which fields are displayed on the cards in Independent Projects boards.

h3. Why this is important
 
This would allow customers to select fields based on their usage, so this would make Independent Project's boards to be more of a visual tool, with the required information displayed without customers having the need to click on the cards.
fields.summary: Allow users to select fields to be displayed on cards in Independent Projects

fields.description: For plans that have teams that use different methods of estimation so that the original estimate can be set for either story point or time-based methodology.
fields.summary: Allow to show both time and story point original estimates columns

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When adding a user as board admin, if the user key have a colon punctuation ( : ), JIRA will stop to read the user key at the colon punctuation ( : ), showing a error message and saying that the value entered till the colon punctuation ( : ) is not a valid user.

Example: 
User key = 557058:3578
Error: 557058 is not a valid user.

!Screen Shot 2018-08-24 at 10.53.20.png|thumbnail! 

*+Important Note:+* User key is not the same as User name, they are two different user attributes, the User key is only visible via database.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new user and make sure that this user have a colon punctuation ( : ) on his user key.
 # Try to add this user as a board admin.


h3. Expected Results

The user will be added as board admin.

h3. Actual Results

The user is not added as board admin and there is a error message saying XXXX is not a valid user.

h3. Workaround

Use groups instead of single users as the board admin.
fields.summary: Unable to add users as board admin if the user key have a colon punctuation ( : ).

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When an issue is part of the sprint, but the status is not mapped to a column. When the user map the status to a column after the sprint starts, it considers it as a *scope change*.

h3. Suggested Solution
Have an option to hide this scope change in the report.
fields.summary: Option to hide scope change due to Open issue moved into board (from an unmapped status)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, if all subtasks of an issue are closed when viewing issues on a Software board, Jira shows the "Update Parent Issue" pop up screen asking if the user wants to also Close the parent issue, as show in the screenshot below:

 !KAIS_board_-_Agile_Board_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow administrators to disable this functionality.

h3. Why this is important

This will allow customers who don't use this feature to stop having to select "Cancel" whenever all the sub-tasks are closed, as they could have different workflows or business cases for which this option is not useful.
 
h3. Workaround 
No workaround available.
fields.summary: Allow Jira administrators to disable the Update Parent Issue pop up screen

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, the pages listed in the "Pages" section after linking a Confluence space are the ones branched from that Space, as shown in the screenshot below:
 !More_testing_-_Testing_-_Confluence.png|thumbnail! 

If a space in Confluence has no pages and all the information is displayed in the "Overview" main page, it won't be displayed in the "Pages" section.
 !Dark_Owl_Records_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow the Overview main page to also be listed in the "Pages" section after a space is linked.

h3. Why this is important

Allow customers that have no pages created from a Space to use this Jira Software feature and still have their information listed.
 
h3. Workaround 
Copy that Overview page so it'll then be displayed in the list.
fields.summary: Allow the Overview main page to be listed in "Pages" section

fields.description: The ordering of comments is not consistent across the preview panel & window view. In one, most recent comment is in ascending order of when it was inserted, in the other most recent comment is on top of list.
fields.summary: Ordering of comments is not consistent in the different views
Pickup code block for copy-paste, instead of having to go into the edit mode necessarily.

fields.description:
# For [Attachments, Sub-tasks & Linked issues], give user the option to VIEW first instead of CREATE/ADD right away. If we need to CREATE/ADD, we'll add it when we're taken there. 
 # Offer the option to EXPAND/COLLAPSE the [Description] on demand with default being collapsed. We should not have to scroll down every time when the [Description] gets too big.
 # If we choose to view as sidebar, bring all relevant fields further up (ex. Assignee). There is also a lot of unused white space.

 

!image-2018-08-23-14-35-07-938.png!
fields.summary: For [Attachments, Sub-tasks & Linked issues], give user the option to VIEW first instead of CREATE/ADD right away. If we need to CREATE/ADD, we'll add it when we're taken there.

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 16 July 2020 }
Hi everyone,

Today we’re excited to announce that [project archiving|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/archive-a-project-1013843066.html] is generally available as part of Jira Software Premium.

With project archiving, you don’t have to delete old or inactive projects – simply archive them and all of their underlying issues. By archiving older projects, you reduce clutter in Jira and always have a record of older work in case you need it. You also don’t have to worry about team members accessing out-of-date work or adding Jira issues to the wrong place.

To try out project archiving start a free Jira Software Premium trial today (go to *billing* → *manage subscriptions* → *change plans*). Or you can learn more about Jira Software Premium [here|https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/premium].

Additionally, if you’re worried about accidentally deleting projects, we also recently rolled out [a new trash feature |https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/trash-for-jira-software-and-jira-core-projects-1001820064.html](available in your Jira site right now) where you can recover any project you’ve deleted for up to 60 days after it’s been deleted.

Thanks,
Ritesh Ranjan
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}
 

I would like to be able to archive projects in Jira Cloud, which is currently not available.

See [How to hide (or archive) a project|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/hide-or-archive-a-project-1001820079.html?_ga=2.218867865.184976810.1587384136-591375001.1577390815] for a workaround.
fields.summary: Ability to archive projects in Jira Cloud

fields.description: I noticed that when a ticket is re-opened all of the time time goes in to the same bucket. Is there any easy or can something be built in to show logged time after a ticket was re-opened. We would like to see the amount of re-work/re-do hours.
fields.summary: Time Logging on re-opened tickets

fields.description:
It would be great if we have the issue navigator for linked issues at the epic level like we have for sub-tasks.
For sub-task
 !image-2018-08-23-09-28-56-356.png|thumbnail! 
For linked issue
 !image-2018-08-23-09-30-53-878.png|thumbnail! 

This feature would assist to filter issues that are still open when having multiple issues linked to the same epic.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to have an issue navigator for linked issues as like it has for sub-task

fields.description:
Based on [Configuring a board|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/configuring-a-board-764477974.html].

To configure the board and any of its settings, you must be either:
 * a *project administrator* for the location of the board
 * a *board administrator* for the board itself

There are cases where users must have project administrator permission, however, users should not have permission to manage any board where the project is set as board location.

User case: I would like to have a user that can change the project settings, however, I don't want this user to modify boards where he is not the board administrator.
fields.summary: Board admin permission - Project admin should not let users manage boards.

fields.description:
This occurs when the “New Jira Ticket View” is enabled in a user’s profile (regardless of New or Old Jira Experience choice). A time estimate is entered, accepted, then deleted quickly after with no further interaction from the user.

The issue is described in more detail in this community post: [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/The-quot-Time-Estimate-quot-field-resets-to-quot-None-quot-after/qaq-p/764577]

We have a current workaround which is to turn off the New Jira ticket view, but would like to know if this view is part of the mandatory rollout of the new Jira Experience in two week's time.

 

Disabling "Jira legacy mode" in time-tracking settings allows time estimates to be set using New Jira ticket view. However, issues can not be set with time estimates using days as a value, for a currently unknown reason.  A warning icon is shown in the time estimate entry field and a cropped error message which cannot be read appears.
fields.summary: Cannot add time estimates in New Jira issue view

fields.description: Ability to update/add ticket fixes version from smart commit for Jira Cloud
fields.summary: Ability to add/set fixes version from smart commit

fields.description:
The Associate Issue Type Screen needs better UX because it can lead to an admin "abandoning" projects from any sort of Issue Type Scheme, which instantly breaks sprints and any ability to move issues in any way across the active workflow.

 

I click "associate" when I wanted to add another project to a specific scheme, which brings me to the "Associate Issue Type Scheme" screen. If I just click the new project that I want to add, upon clicking "Associate" I instantly abandon all other projects from this scheme. When a project is abandoned from an issue type scheme, they can no longer move issues within their workflow, and Sprints are emptied/broken.

 

The "correct" behavior is to ctrl+click on the project you wish to add, without clicking on anything else, and clicking associate.

 

At a minimum, a warning screen should pop-up to inform you if you are about to disassociate a bunch of projects from their issue type schemes.

 

Dropbox image links, because I can't seem to upload screenshots:

* https://www.dropbox.com/s/3dwjl9u5nmetjp2/associate-issue-types.PNG?dl=0

* https://www.dropbox.com/s/dfdfl4cp4az13wz/issue-associate.PNG?dl=0

 

 

!image-2018-08-20-15-51-03-829.png|width=528,height=50!

 

!image-2018-08-20-15-51-35-750.png|width=346,height=182!
fields.summary: Administer - Associate Issue Type Scheme

fields.description: If you have a custom field used in a transition (e.g., in a condition), and you delete the custom field, there is no warning that issues can become stuck in workflows that have such transitions
fields.summary: Add warning when deleting custom fields to check use in transitions

fields.description:
h2. Summary
In Android JIRA App, it is not possible to view the *backlog* of a Kanban project. However, it is possible to view *backlog* for Scrum project.

h2. Steps to Replicate
# Create a board for a Kanban project
# View the Kanban board in Android JIRA App
# The *backlog* button on the top is not there.

h2. Expected Result

There should be a *backlog* button on the top

h2. Current Result

There is no *backlog* button on the top
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Can't view Backlog for Kanban project in JIRA Android App

fields.description:
In the same way an issue is transitioned to _In progress_ when there is any activity in Bitbucket regarding it, it would be nice to have the issue assigned to that specific user that triggered the first activity.

Having an '_Assign issue to current user_' post-function added to the transition does not assign the issue to the user
fields.summary: Issue automatically assigned to the user who does the first activity in Bitbucket regarding it

fields.description:
Current, only 3 fields can be added on card layout for both backlog and sprint views

 

I am re-opening this issue to see if there is any more interest in it
fields.summary: Allow more than 3 fields on card layout

fields.description:
When i have some tickets toggled as open, and i switch filters or i delete a ticket, then other untouched tickets are toggled as open. As like the toggled items are remembered by index instead of unique ids.

This is not expected behavior.
fields.summary: Toggle of Tickets in Board-View should be remembered by ID

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In a Kanban/Sprint board, issue transition occasionally fails due to the request against:
{code:none}
PUT https://<EXAMPLE>.atlassian.net/rest/greenhopper/1.0/xboard/transitionAndRank
{code}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a Kanban/Sprint board at https://<EXAMPLE>.atlassian.net/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=<ID>
 # Create an issue
 # Drag & drop the issue to another column
 # The issue looks successfully transited
 ** However the problematic async requests sometimes don't send back any HTTP response according to HAR.
 ** !Screenshot 2018-08-15 20.11.29.png|thumbnail!
 # Reload the page and verify the issue moves back to the previous column.

h3. Expected Results

The issue successfully transits.
h3. Actual Results

A stacktrace of the error happened in the problematic request looks like:
{code:none}
com.opensymphony.workflow.StoreException: Error marking step #12366 finished at com.opensymphony.workflow.spi.ofbiz.OfbizWorkflowStore.markFinished(OfbizWorkflowStore.java:278)
...
Caused by: org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: canceling statement due to statement timeout Where: while updating tuple (1,100) in relation "os_currentstep" at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.receiveErrorResponse(QueryExecutorImpl.java:2477)
{code}
According to logs, this type of error happens around 200 times per week among Atlassian Cloud instances.
h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: Issue transition occasionally fails due to query timeout
"Development" field data behavior is inconsistent and might give false positives

fields.description:
Hi Team

We are using JIRA 6.4. 
We are planning to move bulk JIRA tickets from one project to another. We tried with bulk move option but here Field name varies from project A to project B.
For example, “Remediation Steps” field in project A and it is “Remediation Steps (for QA only)” in Project B. However, We need the same content of "Remediation Steps" in Project B with filed name "Remediation Steps (for QA only)".
Is there any possible way for bulk process with no loss of data.


Thanks,
Swathy.S
fields.summary: Bulk JIRA tickets process with different fields
Snap@99acres.com is unable to process any ticket

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
 * As User A:
 ** Create 21 private filters (i.e. no shares) as user A with similar names (e.g. "filter A", "filter B", etc)
 * As User B:
 ** Create another private filter as user B with similar name (e.g. "Filter X")
 ** Go to board configuration for any board on instance
 ** Change board filter, searching for the shared part of the name ("filter" in this example)

h3. What happens
 * No results show up, even though there is a result "Filter X".

h3. What should happen

The selected filter should appear in the list.
h3. Workaround

Choose a non-similar word ("X" in the example)
fields.summary: Filter selection does not show selection results if many non-permitted filters match the result

fields.description:
When a Jira agility project is deleted, all sprints that are active on it cannot be deleted nor can reports from them be viewed.

Steps to reproduce:
 # Create a new agility project
 # Create a sprint on the board and add issues.
 # Start the sprint.
 # Delete the board.
 # Sprint stays active and cannot be ended and report page is blank.
 Active sprints from deleted boards are still displayed in the 'Sprint' field suggestions too, which may be confusing for the users.

*Expected behaviour*
 When a user attempts to delete a board, show a notification about the active sprints and let them choose to either complete or remove the sprints, or keep them active.
fields.summary: On agility projects, related sprints remain active after a board is deleted

fields.description:
In the backlog, the sprint dates (start end end) are displayed for every planned sprint.
 In the active sprint board, the sprint dates are not displayed.

The sprint dates should also be displayed in the active sprint board.
fields.summary: Active sprint dates should be displayed in active sprint board

fields.description: Like the other users in [this community post]([https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/How-to-add-an-issue-to-the-Kanban-board-from-the-Kanban-board/qaq-p/22062),] I was perplexed as to how I could create an issue directly from the Kanban board on a project. I then realized that the "create issue" button being referenced was the one on the sidebar of the page. However, I also noticed that the business "board" view DID have a "create new issue" button directly on the Kanban board under "backlog". From a usability standpoint (especially since my organization is looking to use Jira with end-users), it would be great to have that button present so that it's obvious in some way how a new issue is created.
fields.summary: Make creating a new issue on a Kanban board more obvious

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Smart commits are not working for Github integration.
The commits are shown on the Development Panel however if a comment is added to the commit message, this comment is not added to the issue.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud integrated with Github

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Perform a commit with a message. e.g.: KEY-1 # comment test

h3. Expected Results
Commands added to the commit message are performed

h3. Actual Results
The commit is listed on the Development Panel but the commands on commit message fail
 
h3. Notes
* 

h3.Workaround
*
fields.summary: Smart commits are not working for Github integration

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Users are unable to edit issues if _Sprint_ field is shown on screen and they don't have _schedule permission_.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Remove the users from _schedule permission_
# Add the _sprint_ field on edit issue screen
# Try editing the issue (any field)

h3. Expected Results
Issue is updated if the _Sprint_ field value is not changed.

h3. Actual Results
The issue is not updated:
{noformat}
There were some errors when trying to create this issue
We couldn't make that happen because you don't have Schedule Issues permission.
{noformat}

h3. Workaround.

Remove the "Sprint" field from the screens.
fields.summary: Users are unable to edit issues without schedule permission if the "Sprint" field is on the Edit screen

fields.description:
Right now, there is no option to reopen sprints on next-gen boards.

Workaround
# Create a filter that will return issues from that sprint.
# Create a new scrum board based on this new filter.
# Follow the steps in [Reopening a sprint|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/reopening-a-sprint-785332001.html] to reopen the sprint.
fields.summary: Reopen sprints on next-gen boards.

fields.description:
If we have a future sprint that is being renamed along the weeks and months and it has not started and, by somehow, some of the issues that are assigned to this sprint were worked and completed but the sprint field is not removed from the issue, it will be hidden from the backlog view.
However, if we start this sprint, all the issues will be displayed on the active sprint and on the board.

I'd like to be advised when starting a future sprint about starting with completed/closed issues and be given an option to remove those issues from the sprint before it gets started.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to be informed when starting a future sprint about completed issues being included that were hidden on backlog

fields.description:
Hello

I have many saved filters in Jira, however they are not opening correctly. Regardless of which saved filter I click on, it is bringing me to the same filter.
fields.summary: Jira Filters Not Loading

fields.description:
!image-2018-08-13-09-56-40-804.png!

Anytime you click next page on dashboard my previous icon is a comma? Looking at html it should probably be << so get it together and fix it !!!

Thanks and have a good day
fields.summary: Previous Icon

fields.description:
Very often when performing a major action in JIRA you're redirected back to the Issue Navigator, losing the Project you were on at the moment of the execution. 

||Original request|| 
|There are a number of cases in which I'm working on a specific project in JIRA, but JIRA loses that project context because of some actions.\\ \\For instance when I want to release a software version after a Sprint I do the following:\\ \\Active sprints\\Complete sprint\\Within Sprint Report -> View in Issue Navigator (now my project context is gone)\\Then I bulk change the issues and set them to the new release version\\ \\Then I want to continue working in the project, but the project context is gone. I need to do the following to get back to the project:\\ \\Hit back within issues and filters\\Select projects\\Select my project again\\ \\Obviously this should not be necessary and I should be able to continue working on the project without these 3 steps. I think I also encountered some other cases that made me lose my project context, but I can't recall them now.\\ \\Apart from this issue the release version procedure is very cumbersome and I know that somewhere in the past I could just "Release" the sprint as a version, which did not require the manual bulk update action.|
fields.summary: JIRA loses the Project currently on when performing certain actions

fields.description:
As a Product Owner (and ScrumMaster) I would like the ability to sort a sprint backlog in plan-view without affecting rank (and without affecting backlog) by the following
*Must have*
* by epic
* by story point value (highest to lowest)

*Nice to have*
* by fixversion
* by ticket type
* by priority

Not required but...
* when sort by story points, if stories are in the same epic and values are the same, group those stories together

See rough visual mockups in JSWSERVER-16486
fields.summary: Sort sprint backlog in plan-view (by epic or by story point value)

fields.description: appropriate material
fields.summary: design for training testing

fields.description:
When comments are overflowing it can difficult to reach the information you seek, to save some comments having emotes, a like or approve/disapprove button would help answering a comment without needing to actually reply.

 

Thanks for your time and for providing the best Database I know. I am in Video Game QA and I won't do without it.

 

Cheers!
fields.summary: Add emote or like button to Comments section in Activities.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, if you integrate Jira Cloud with Bitbucket Cloud, and add a repository link into a Jira software project, there is no Project setting to select or specify a default Bitbucket Repository.

When you create a bug and then want to work on fixing it by creating a new Branch from a Bitbucket Repository,  the repopulated list will give you all repositories that the current user has access to and it's easy to select a wrong repository and create a branch from there, this leads to mistakes and lost time. 
h3. Suggested Solution

Give the users the ability to specify a default set of repositories per project in JIRA, this way users can avoid creating branches at the wrong repositories.
fields.summary: Give the ability from Jira project settings to specify Bitbucket Repository as default

fields.description: Right now, we can move an issue from one project to another. It would be helpful if we could move a version (and all its issues) from a project to another (in my case, we are creating a derived-project).
fields.summary: As a Jira Software project administrator, I want to move a version from a project to another

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Legend of Cumulative Flow Diagram legend hides information

h3. Environment
Jira Software cloud


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Scrum project
# Add issues to the project
# Transition them among statuses
# Access the Cumulative Flow Diagram report

h3. Expected Results

The chart and legend display properly

h3. Actual Results

The chart legend hides information

 !Screen Shot 2018-08-07 at 6.57.57 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Notes


h3.Workaround
Not for now
fields.summary: Legend of Cumulative Flow Diagram legend hides information

fields.description:
a picture is worth a thousand words:'

 !burndown chart.png|thumbnail! 

The burndown chart seems to be rendered incorrectly, as the legend overlaps on the actual graph
fields.summary: Burndown chart is not rendered correctly

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, merging a commit via PR will inherit the commit message from the actual commit. If the actual commit has a smart commit such as #time 5m, the merged commit will has #time 5m too. This causes the smart commit to be processed twice in Jira.

h3. Suggested Solution
Have the ability to ignore the smart commit message in the merged commit.
fields.summary: Ability to ignore and not process the Merged Commit message as smart commit

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The active sprint board maintain the search result without a visually applied filter

h3. Environment
Jira Software cloud


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Select "Active Sprints"
# Enter anything into the filter text box at the top of the screen\
# Select "Backlog" (notice how the filter textbox doesn't have anything in it anymore)
# Select "Active Sprints".

h3. Expected Results

# The board is displayed properly or,
# The search box keeps the value of the previous search

h3. Actual Results

The filter text box is empty but the search value used before switching boards is still applied.

 [^Screen Recording 2018-08-06 at 08.18 PM.mov] 


h3.Notes


h3.Workaround
Refresh the board's page
fields.summary: Active Sprint search UI bug

fields.description:
In the Advanced settings of JIRA, sub-tasks columns can be configured with the *jira.table.cols.subtasks* key. By the default the *progress* column is included which is viewable from the Issue Navigator.

 !_CLEAN-8__Progress_testing_-_JIRA.png|thumbnail! 

Currently, this is viewable nor configurable on the Board view, thus users do not have the same level of flexibility when viewing sub-tasks via their parent.

 !CLEAN_board_-_Agile_Board_-_JIRA.png|thumbnail! 

||Original request||
|Why in Jira cloud I can't see the progress of subtasks on the Board view? I need to enter each and every subtasks and calculate the times to understand the impact of this tasks on my sprint. only inside the tasks, i can see the real estimated time.
i want to see the progress of all tasks related to the parent task.|
fields.summary: Sub-tasks columns on Boards not configurable

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Release page is not opening through project page, only through project settings > Versions

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Write at sublime the project name and use the tab key to separate two words
# Copy and paste this to the project name in Jira
# Apply the changes and try to open the release page
# The page will not load

h3. Expected Results
The release page should load normally

h3. Actual Results
Page doesn't load and javascript errors are thrown on browser console. This error occurs because the script cannot get the project information:
 !Screen Shot 2018-08-02 at 2.48.02 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Access project releases through Project Settings > Versions
Rename the project name by excluding any "tab" (line break) character
fields.summary: As a user, I'm not able to open Release page from Project screen, it only loads a white page - for Projects with a TAB character in their name

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Assignee Filter value in Active Sprint/Backlog is reset after page refresh.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Have Scrum board with some issues and assign some of it to any user
 * Select any user from _Assignee Filter_
 **  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 * Navigate to Backlog and back to Active Sprint (The selected assignee is still the same)
 * Refresh the page

h3. Expected Result

Assignee value stays the same
h3. Actual Result

Assignee value is reset and becomes empty.
fields.summary: Assignee Filter value is reset after page refresh

fields.description:
In the Issue Navigator, you can quickly Transition, Edit or Comment on sub-tasks when viewing the parent. This isn't possible on the Backlog view of a Board. This should be included in the Backlog side Issue view as well to increase productivity.

h2. Backlog side Issue view
 !SCRUM_board_-_Agile_Board_-_JIRA.png|thumbnail! 

h2. Issue Navigator
 !_SCRUM-90__Testing_Story_number_CSV_1058_-_JIRA.png|thumbnail! 


||Original request||
|I can't find out how to be able to quickly edit the status of subtasks when looking in the split screen boards vie.  I was honestly surprised that there isn't a way to set that up now, since its clearly more functional, and it already works like that in other screens|
fields.summary: Transition sub-tasks when viewing the parent in the Backlog side view

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Remaining time estimate breaks in the burndown report when updating the Original Estimate and adding a worklog in the same edit screen.


h3. Steps to Reproduce

- Set the Edit screen configuration to include the *Time tracking* and *Log Work* fields
- Create an issue and add it to a sprint. 
- Edit the issue and set the *Original Estimate* to 1d and log work with the same value. 
- !update.png|thumbnail! 
- Inspect the Burndown : Remaining time estimate report

h3. Expected Results

- RTE logged indicating that 1d is added (Time Estimate)
- RTE logged indicating that 1d is decreased from remaining time estimate (Time Spent)


h3. Actual Results

 !burndown report.png|thumbnail! 

Original time estimate is added to the report but there is no indication of the time spent data. 
 

h3.Workaround
In general, the issue estimation is performed during sprint planning. When it is needed to be updated after the sprint is started, perform a separate update for original estimate and the logging of work.
fields.summary: Remaining time estimate breaks in the burndown report

fields.description:
Hello everyone,

I have a question that I hope I can solve with your help, I have two JIRA Software installations (7.8.4 and 7.1.7), in both we have several users that access through LDAP and I would like to know how JIRA acts when it eliminates some of the users in the LDAP directory, does it also eliminate the user in JIRA having or not assigned issues ?, does not delete it but leaves it inactive and the issues continue assigned to it?.

Thank you very much in advance, regards.
fields.summary: LDAP users synchronization

fields.description:
h2. Summary

Since the BigPicture add-on has a synchronize version date setting, sometimes it can modify releases dates from customer instance without any warning.

h2. Steps to Replicate
This setting can be changed via the "Program" settings here: https://<instancename>.atlassian.net/plugins/servlet/ac/eu.softwareplant.bigpicture/bigpicture-manage-programs-module?ac.programId=

# Click the "cog" icon 
# Configure  
# Synchronization 
# Untick the *Synchronize JIRA versions box*  
# Save and sync.

h2. Expected Result

The Release Burndown report could show the modification done by BigPicture. Or we could have a feature like _Audit Log_ for releases so customer will be aware of these changes made by the add-on

h2. Current Result

Customer needs to open a ticket with us so we can confirm/inform them about this problem.
fields.summary: BigPicture synchronize version date changes easily visible to customers
Correct error message on moving issues to Backlog

fields.description:
h3. Summary

As per the title, swimlanes of boards that are created via copy board function does not have their swimlanes properly saved. They exist but they don't actually work
h3. Steps to Replicate
 # Create a board with a few swimlanes.
 # Create a new board by copying the board in step 1.
 # Check the swimlanes of the new copied board.

h3. Expected Results

Copied board should show the swimlanes, in the exact same order.
h3. Current Results

Copied board does not show any swimlanes at all on its view. In the board settings, they do appear, but they are out of the original order.

h3. Workaround

Go to the swimlanes configuration under board settings, and change the order of at least one swimlane.

You can create a new one (or recreate), and then re-order the other existing swimlanes above it. You can then delete the new swimlane.
fields.summary: Board swimlanes not saved properly on copy

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Board not displayed properly when an issue is transitioned and the user who transitioned it has no "schedule issue" permission


h3. Environment



h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create Kanban Board
# Add Swimlanes based on *Stories* 
# Remove the "Schedule permission" from the user used on the test
# Transition issues to a column to another

h3. Expected Results
The board is displayed properly 

h3. Actual Results
The board header is displayed on the middle of the board, disturbing the transition of other tickets, and the following error is displayed on the board's console

 !Screen Shot 2018-07-27 at 8.25.37 PM.png|thumbnail! 


h3.Notes


h3.Workaround
Grant the "Schedule issues" permission to the affected user
fields.summary: Board not displayed properly when issue is transitioned and the user does not have the "schedule issue" permission

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When viewing Version dates between the Backlog "Versions" tab and the Releases page, if the time-zone of your user and browser do not match the global Jira timezone, the values will be displayed differently.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a version
# Go to the backlog view, and open the release version in the "Versions" tab
# Set a start and end date
# Compare to the Releases page, the values are likely to match.
# Go to Jira settings
# Change the global timezone
# return to the backlog and releases pages and compare the dates. The date will no longer match. This is irrespective of user timezone selection

h3. Expected Results

The dates always match

h3. Actual Results
The date display will change in the backlog view and does not change in the releases menu.
 
h3. Notes
Testing the User-specific time-zone setting does not seem to impact what is displayed. Only the global value seems to be considered.

h3.Workaround
No Workaround At this Time
fields.summary: Version Dates use different time-zone data when rendering between backlog view and Releases page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Details:
n the Kanaban backlog, if a story has subtasks, then you can't drag the story onto an epic to add that story to the epic. 

After you drag it, it comes up with the message "you can't add sub-tasks to epics" - note that I'm not dragging the subtasks, but the actual story.

h3. Workaround:
The workaround is to drag only the parent Story so that it will work.

e.g., 
In the below example, 'Story 2' has a sub-task and 'Story 3' with two sub-tasks in it.

Click on the greater than symbol against the parent story so that it will display the sub-task in it.

 !Sub-task1.png|thumbnail! 

Now, drag only the 'Story 2' to Epic panel so that it will be added to the epic.
 !Sub-task2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggestion:
The concern is that most of the normal users are not aware of this workaround and it would be helpful to display the UI error with specific details instead of generic error - "you can't add sub-tasks to epics".
fields.summary: Stories with sub-tasks can't be dragged into Epic in Kanban Backlog/Plan mode

fields.description:
I have come across an issue in Jira that I was unable to figure out. I am implementing a new policy within my organization. This policy states that on a specific ticket type, it must have a minimum number of votes before it can be approved. I was going to attempt to enforce this policy by adding a Post Function to check the number of votes before allowing the "approved" button to display. As the project lead, I am often informed that a ticket of this type needs to be created. As the reporter of the issue, my vote in cast as a yes. Whether or not that is my opinion.  The current workaround for this is to create the ticket, go in to edit the ticket to change the reporter, then cast a vote. 
I have a few issues with this. 
 # Automatically assuming the reporter of an issue is in favor is both unnecessary and adds no value to the functionality of the Jira software. 
 # Forcing the vast amount of users to complete an ad hoc workaround for a functionality that is within the software that our companies pay for with a simple explanation of "We consider the initial report of an Issue to be an implicit vote; therefore, it would be redundant for a Reporter to vote up her own Issue." - John Garcia Aug 6,2014 [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Questions/Why-can-t-some-users-VOTE-on-an-issue-when-others-can/qaq-p/31523]
 # This limits one of the biggest buying features of the Jira software which for my organization would the the vast customization and versatility of the Jira platform. Designing policies and procedures with Jira as the focal point of documentation, limitations  such as this as completely unnecessary 
 # Enabling this feature, (I would assume) could not be that vast of an upgrade or costly hot fix.

Thank you for your time.

Brandon
fields.summary: Removal of voter restrictions.

fields.description:
404 error for [https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/$%7bsoftware.help.space%7d/Using+the+Simplified+Workflow]

Board, configure board, Columns then the question mark for more information on workflows gives 404 error. Since link goes to atlassian.com looks like a problem at your side

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If you create your instance using a time zone that is not configured in Jira, the system will take this time zone as default, however, it will return an Internal Server Error when you try to access a project in the instance.

As an example, a customer created his instance using the time zone (GMT+4 Europe/Saratov) and Jira got this time zone as default to the system, however, this time zone is not available in Jira, there is just (GMT+4 Europe/Samara) in the system.

 !Europe Saratov.png|thumbnail! 

So, when you try to access any project in the instance, the system returns an Internal Server Error.

We believe that the same behavior could happen using another time zones that are not configured in Jira.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Change the time zone of your computer to (GMT+4 Europe/Saratov).
# Create a new Jira instance.
# Create a project and try to open it.
_You have the same behavior if you change the time zone to (GMT+4 Europe/Saratov) direct in the database._

h3. Expected Results
The system should inform the user that time zone is not available in Jira and ask him to select a similar one.

The error could have a message informing that it's related to the time zone configuration and asking the user the change it.

h3. Actual Results

Jira just return a *Jira - Internal Server Error*.

 !Internal Server Error.png|thumbnail! 

In the logs, you can find a message informing that this error is related to the time zone configuration.

 !Error Log.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
As a workaround, we changed the Time Zone to a similar one, in our example we change from (GMT+4 Europe/Saratov) to (GMT+4 Europe/Samara).
fields.summary: Internal Server Error when trying to access a project using a time zone that is not configured in Jira.

fields.description:
It would be helpful to have a Notification Event that would be based on when an issue is added to a Sprint.

Most important is to know when issues are added to a sprint that is already underway; it is not important for future sprints that haven't begun yet.

This reason for this is so that we can ensure an issue of equal size is removed from the current sprint whenever a new one is added.
fields.summary: Notification Event for when Issues are added to a Sprint

fields.description: Currently, the commits timestamp is only displayed at the Development Panel, but as a user, I'd like to have it displayed with all the changes in the ticket in chronological time at the issue history tab.
fields.summary: As an user, I'd like to have the commits timestamp also displayed under the history of the issue

fields.description:
Within the board side bar issue view, multi line text custom fields values are overlapping the field box limits when collapsed. 
The text is collapsed to fit on a line and overlap the input field. The field content is continuing at the right of the pencil/edit button where it should be hidden as out of its field's right limit. The edit pen still appears, but it looks nasty, because the text continues under and overlap on its right.
 !Screen Shot 2018-07-24 at 16.40.28.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2018-07-24 at 16.40.35.png|thumbnail! 

Workaround:

- Use the New JIRA Issue View
- Use another View
fields.summary: Multiline text field text values are overlapping their field once collapsed within the Board Side bar (old) Issue view

fields.description:
h3. Summary
"Add Status" button ignores permission setting and is restricted to administrators group 

h3. Environment
# Create a Jira Software project in the following(default) setting
## Application access configuration(https://instance.atlassian.net/admin/accessconfig): Jira administration set to:
*** administrators
*** jira-administrators
*** site-admins
## Global permission(https://instance.atlassian.net/secure/admin/GlobalPermissions!default.jspa): Administer Jira set to:
*** administrators
*** system-administrators
*** atlassian-addons-admin
*** site-admins
*** jira-administrators
## Project permission(https://instance.atlassian.net/plugins/servlet/project-config/project/permissions): Administer Projects set to:
*** Project Role(Administrators)
*** Project Role(atlassian-addons-project-access)
## People(https://instance.atlassian.net/plugins/servlet/project-config/project/people):
*** jira-administrators set as Administrators Role
# Prepare an account which belongs to the following groups:
*** site-admins
*** jira-administrators

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# With the account whose group is set as above, acess to the project created above
# Navigate to "Board Settings" > "Columns"

h3. Expected Results
"Add Status" button is available

h3. Actual Results
"Add Status" button is disabled.
Adding the user to "administrators" group will enable this button though this symptom doesn't match the permission set above
 
h3.Workaround
Add user to administrators group
fields.summary: "Add Status" button ignores permission setting and is restricted to administrators group

fields.description:
We have a team of about 40 ppl using Jira Cloud as our project management software. We have recently transitioned over to Jira for our Timesheet software. 

We have found that our team is confused on how to log minutes into the input as the label is unclear. 

The current label is "(eg. 3w 4d 12h)" and when the team are trying to log 30 mins they assume that the correct input is 0.5h, however, it is actually 30m but it isn't mentioned in the label. [|https://adrenalinmedia.atlassian.net/secure/ShowTimeTrackingHelp.jspa]

I know that it is in the support page but we found most users will not actively follow the link. 

Can we please update the label to include minutes such as "(eg. 3w 4d 12h 30m)"?[|https://adrenalinmedia.atlassian.net/secure/ShowTimeTrackingHelp.jspa]

Thanks.
fields.summary: Label unclear on Time Spent Input on Logging Work screen

fields.description:
h3. Summary
There is a typo in the Versions tooltip when you hover the mouse over it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access the Backlog view of a project with versions
# Mouse over one of the versions

h3. Expected Results
The tooltip should say *x% of estimated work done (x of x Done)*

h3. Actual Results
The tooltip says *x% of estimated work done (x of x None)*
!mouseover-typo.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Typo in the Versions tooltip

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Deleted branches which mention issue keys on Bitbucket are still visible on the issue's development panel 

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud integrated with Bitbucket cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Create a branch mentioning an issue key
* Delete the branch on Bitbucket

h3. Expected Results
The branch info disappears from the issue's development panel

h3. Actual Results
The branch information is still visible on the issue's development panel
 
h3. Notes
* 

h3.Workaround
fields.summary: Bitbucket branch deletion is not being reflected on Development Panel
As a Jira Software user, I want to see the total of story points per assignee in the backlog view

fields.description:
According to the [Configuring working days|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/configuring-working-days-764478050.html] and [Control Chart|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/control-chart-777002660.html] documentations.

We can exclude the Non Working Days defined in the board settings but there are no way to exclude the non working hours from the reports.
 !Screen Shot 2018-07-18 at 15.38.40.png|thumbnail! 

Also, the documentation or the report should be clearer about the value of a day in hours within the report. 

thanks
fields.summary: option to exclude the non working hours from the Control Chart Report

fields.description:
h3.Summary 

As described in title, attempting to sort the epic link column/field now returns the 'An unknown error occurred while trying to perform a search.' error.

h3.Steps to Replicate

# Click on the 'All Issues' filter at the side to display all projects.
# Add the 'Epic Link' column to the search results.
# Sort the 'Epic Link' column by clicking it.

h3.Expected Behavior

Issues displayed sorted based on epic link.

h3.Current Behavior

'An unknown error occurred while trying to perform a search.' is shown instead.

!Untitled.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Epic Link returns error when sorted in issue navigator

fields.description:
It would be good to have JQL capable of pulling all the tickets from a project along with the exact sprint name in which the ticket was marked as resolved/closed. 

Currently, JQL allows to pull the tickets based on resolved date. However, this will not allow to pull the exact sprint name in which the ticket was closed.

The 'Sprint' column name does not give what is intended as it shows all the sprints the ticket was assigned to.

Although Sprint report provides the data as expected, it't not practical to run the report manually for every sprint.
fields.summary: JQL to list all the tickets closed along with the actual Sprint in which they are closed.

fields.description: There is currently no way see the history of bugs/issues in Jira in the "New View".  Today we had to switch to the old view during a meeting to view the bug history.
fields.summary: There is no way to view history of issues in the "New View"

fields.description: To allow that when you pass the mouse over the project name that appear in the menu of the left side, the complete name of the project should appear in a tag.
fields.summary: To allow that complete project name appears in a tag

fields.description:
Whenever an issues is fully closed out, and then if at some point is re-opened due to a related bug or something, it does not return to a user's Assigned/Watched board. This can be particularly troublesome if you get lots of Jira emails everyday and don't get the notification that something has been re-opened...and then gets stuck in limbo for weeks because it does not appear on your boards.

I think if you click the Re-Open button, it should remove whatever status was assigned upon completion, such as "Done" or "Fixed", and then return to a user's assigned/watched boards, respectively.
fields.summary: Problem when Closing/Re-opening Issues

fields.description:
h4. Current behavior

You can click all the swimlane title area to expand the swimlane, but to collapse it, it is necessary to click on a small arrow icon

 [^Screen Recording 2018-07-13 at 08.51 PM.mov] 

h4. Expected behavior

I want to be able to collapse the swimlane by clicking on the swimlane title area, as it expands
fields.summary: As a Jira Software user, I want all board swimlane title text as a clickable area to expand and collapse the swimlane area

fields.description:
please see page [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/release-burndown-777002702.html] currently the there is an excerpt macro on the page that is including the text "Jira Software" but it's doing to with an extra

which makes the page look bad. !badlinebreak.png|thumbnail!   I found the include page seems to be [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASOFTWARECLOUD/_JS_GHname] and I tried to edit this page myself to remove the

tags from this page. However this does not appear to have fixed the problem. Please help.
fields.summary: excerpt include on jsw reporting documentation looks poor
Configuring a board documentation has a broken macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The inline Issue creation function in the Backlog turns into a static button that no longer functions when cycling through Epics in the Epic panel.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Board (tested on SCRUM) and create multiple Epics
# With the Epics panel expanded, cycle through the Epics by clicking on them

h3. Expected Results
You can create an Issue in the Backlog with the inline issue creation.

 !CLEAN_board_-_Agile_Board_-_JIRA_inline.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
You get a "*+ Create Issue*" button which has no function
The below exception is thrown in the Dev console:
{code:html}
<button type="button">Create issue</button>
{code}

 !CLEAN_board_-_Agile_Board_-_JIRA.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3.Workaround
Click on another Epic
fields.summary: Inline Create issue in Backlog gets lost
